result.execSummary:
The defendant Marsha R. Books was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unauthorized Use of Food Stamps (<=$100) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.92(2)(f).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.   Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.    Actively search for employment, be employed and maintain employment or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, sample previously provided.
*Pay restitution in the sum of $ 144.99 plus surcharges.   
*Add the 5% restitution surcharge now.
Comply with any court orders, i.e. JV or FA court orders

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marsha R. Books

records.addlTxt: Restitution stipulated to by the defendant and to be released forthwith.
for Restitution Order
for Restitution
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Judge Dreyfus acting for Branch 3.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Drew Lehman appeared for the State.  Deft appeared along w/Atty Michelle Knapp.  VRC.  Case is resolved.  State filed an amended misd. information.  Deft pleads guilty to the amended charge; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 12mos.  See conditions.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $144.99.  To be paid w/in the first 6mos of probation.  DNA surcharge ordered; sample previously provided.  Appeal rights.
Plea hearing on June 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on June 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
plea hrg to be rescheduled; defense counsel out ill

Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
